children.title: Celestial Shaadis
children.subtitle: Wedding Planning Service
paragraphs: Designing, developing, and deploying a promotional website for a wedding planning service.
Celestial Shaadis is a wedding planning service located in the GTA, offering a range of services from day-of-coordination, partial, MC, and full wedding planning.

children.title: The challenge
children.subtitle: Building a promotional website
paragraphs: Celestial Shaadis was a newly launched local business that built its initial audience and brand presence through Instagram and TikTok.
As the business grew, they needed a centralized website to clearly showcase their services and capture leads.
I worked closely with the business from the outset to define requirements, align on expectations, and ensure a smooth delivery process.

children.caption: Celestial Shaadis’ Instagram account, which served as the primary marketing channel prior to the website.

children.title: Starting point & constraints
children.subtitle: Constraints that shaped the technical approach
paragraphs: At the start of the project, I was given a short delivery window of a week and had to work within a limited budget.
The solution needed to be quick to build, inexpensive to maintain, and simple enough to operate without ongoing technical overhead.
These constraints shaped both the scope of the site and the technical approach moving forward.

children.caption: Deciding on a tech stack to meet tight constraints

children.title: Technical approach
children.subtitle: Balancing speed, simplicity, and maintainability
paragraphs: Given the tight timeline and limited budget, I chose a stack I could work with efficiently, deciding on React for the frontend and Vite for the build tooling to keep development fast and lightweight.

Because the site was intended to be fully static, I looked for low-cost solutions to handle contact form submissions without introducing a backend. I settled on EmailJS, which allowed emails to be sent directly from the frontend and fit well within the expected usage limits.
To ensure fast delivery and a straightforward setup, I opted for Cloudflare for both static hosting and DNS management.
Finally, to provide the business owner with visibility into how users interacted with the site, I integrated Google Analytics to track engagement after launch.

children.caption: Centralized lead capture through a simple, user-friendly consultation form

children.title: Outcome
children.subtitle: How the website delivered value for the client
paragraphs: After implementing the site with this stack, the website launched smoothly within the tight timeline, providing the client with a centralized platform to showcase their services and help attract new clients.
